meanings.definition: Tending to grow or move towards light.
meanings.sent1: The phototropic plant turned its leaves towards the sun for more sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The flowers in the garden are phototropic, always leaning towards the window.
meanings.sent3: The phototropic tree seemed to be doing a dance as it swayed towards the light.
meanings.sent4: Her phototropic nature guided her towards positivity and brightness in life.
meanings.sent5: The phototropic behavior of the plant was like a magnet pulling it towards the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Exhibiting a positive response to light.
meanings.sent1: The phototropic insects were attracted to the bright lamp in the room.
meanings.sent2: The phototropic bacteria thrived in the well-lit environment of the laboratory.
meanings.sent3: The phototropic cat eagerly followed the sunbeam around the room.
meanings.sent4: His phototropic personality shone brightly in social gatherings.
meanings.sent5: The phototropic effect on the room was evident as the light illuminated every corner.
